name: One King West Hotel & Residence

reviews.text: I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. First, location. I took public transportation from the airport which if you have some time and want to save some money, this is the way to go. For $2.50 I took the Rocket bus (#192) to Kipling Station and then took the Subway to the King stop and walked upstairs to find the hotel. Overall the trip took about an hour. Upon arrival at the hotel at 12:40pm was told that my room was ready which was a pleasant surprise (I was prepared just to drop off my bags and head over to the Rogers Centre). The guy who checked me in suggested I take a cab if I wanted to make it to the game on time which I did. It's about a $6 cab ride otherwise it's about a 25 min walk (which I did on my way back from the game). Next, the room itself was wonderful which a nice kitchen and very comfy bed. I had an interior room so no view but that's fine since I wasn't planning on spending much time in the room. The floor I was on was very quiet so I was able to sleep like a baby. The decor was very nice and modern and the bathroom was a nice size. I would have liked to see a hook of sorts to hang your towel especially since they are into reusing to conserve energy.
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was only there for one night so I can't comment on the maid service but all in all everything else was great. On Sunday I stored my bag so I could continue sightseeing. Toronto is a great city with lots to do and easily accesible for folks like me who like to walk. I was fortunate to be there this weekend when they were having an outdoor Art Exhibit on the grounds of City Hall. Wow, what a great time, with tons of local artists selling their work. I took a harbor tour which was very nice. Didn't get a chance to go up the CN Tower (next time) nor enough the many great restaurants they have (Summerlicious was also happening and I didn't take advantage of it either).
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.disliked: — My ears popping in the lifts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is near all if you walk or take public transportation. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in Toronto.
reviews.title: Worst Experience Ever - Buyer Beware

likes.liked: — Nothing other than the toilet flushed

reviews.text: We spent our first 2 nights of our trip in this hotel and cannot rate it highly enough. We stayed on the 24th floor, overlooking the harbour (opposite side from CN Tower). The room was bright, modern and functional. The kitchen area was ideal as we were able to wash and dry clothes for the rest of our trip! The bed was so comfortable we slept like babies! The staff were incredibly helpful, always saying "Good morning, how are you?" as you passed.
reviews.title: Close to Everything

reviews.text: We also asked the concierge about train services for the next part of our trip, and he was very helpful and let us use the hotel phone.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: My now fiance and I met on an online dating site, and stayed at One King West during our first weekend getaway. It was late November, and the lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas... so festive! Room service was wonderful- food was delicious. The view from our room (41st floor) was AMAZING!!! We plan to return each year on our anniversary.
reviews.title: A dream!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our 2nd wedding anniversary, I surprised my husband by booking a room at One King West - we had our wedding at the hotel so thought it would be a nice surprise to go back. It was a perfect evening!
reviews.title: A perfect anniversary at One King West

reviews.text: I'd mentioned it was our anniversary when booking, and when we checked in the guest service woman wished us a happy anniversary which was lovely! And we were sent a bottle of wine and some chocolate strawberries from hotel management as well - we were very touched.
reviews.title: Favourite hotel in downtown Toronto

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely - even while they are doing some renovations in the lobby it is very classy looking. Our room was beautiful with a stunning view of the city, it was very quiet, the bed was super comfortable, and every staff person we encountered was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Good standards, excellent location

reviews.text: It was a lovely way to celebrate a happy occasion.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: I was lookiing forward to staying in this hotel since it was rated pretty highly. This was orginally a bank building that has been converted to a hotel. As you enter you feel like you have come to an upscale place. From the concierge to the front desk staff they provided very good service. This was very promising. We had a suite so we found the room reasonably large and it included a mini kitchen, although you felt like you were in a backelor apartment suite. The TV was an old tube style, the carpets looked like they had seen better days. The sound insulation was poor, we could hear the TV next door and late in the night as people were returning it was very noisy.
reviews.title: Great location, Good Service, noisy rooms

reviews.text: The common areas of this hotel look a little worn, and it does take a while to get to your floor with the elevator system. I was lucky to be allocated a renovated room, with a good kitchen area (including brand-new dishwasher and washing machine!). My colleague had similar facilities but said his room was shabby, with very little natural light. The free wifi worked well, and the hotel was convenient for the meeting I attended. I didn’t use any of the other facilities.
reviews.title: Good hotel if you get a renovated room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at One King West on September 18th 2011 for the Toronto International Film Festival. It's a little hard to drive there as there valet is on a small side street that wasn't the easiest to get too. Check in was a breeze and the lobby was very clean and looked very inviting. We stayed on the 34th floor in a one bedroom suite. Very nice room, you could tell the hotel is a little older. Some things in the room that made it look dated is Picture tube TV's, stains on the curtains, stains on the carpets, scrapes in the bathtub, missing caulking etc.... this is all to be expected when the hotel isn't new. You cannot beat the location of this hotel though, you are steps away from Eaton Center, a couple of blocks away from most theatres in the city and very close to a zillion great restaurants. One thing that did annoy me was I had asked for some chocolate covered strawberries to be in the room when we checked in and I told them exactly when we were checking in. They did not arrive, we were in the room for 2 hours before going out for dinner, upon our return from dinner and a movie at 11:30pm they were there and the chocolate was melted off them even though there was a fridge for them to put them in so I found this annoying. Other then that the hotel is very nice but the best attribute of this place is the location, you cannot beat it.
reviews.title: Excellent location.

reviews.text: So the fire alarm went off at 12.15 at night.Not much direction what to do and a lame tannoy message later I walk down 15 floors with my case.40 mns later all over.
reviews.title: One time stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good things are that the staff are nice but look overworked throughout.The room was NOTHING like any of pictures on the site.Ill fitting kitchen cupboards and a stinky fridge do not spell quality.There was clearly a smoker in my room even though I asked for a non smoking room as the carpet reeked of cigarettes.The bed is comfortable although overall the room was cold because of ill fitting doors.I wouldn't stay here again and having booked it on our in house work website have fed back as much.The neighborhood is pretty yucky but there is a good eatery 2 blocks down called Marche which is like a nice food court.Avoid eating at the hotel...expensive and bad.
reviews.title: Good value for money, great location

reviews.text: Stayed May 13-18, 2007. Took flat fee limo from airpoirt to hotel. Cost was $50. Check in was smooth and quick. They gave me a choice of a room on the 27th floor with a view and a stand up shower or a corner suite on the 8th floor with a full size tub/shower combination. I took the 8th floor room and had a nice view of King and Yonge Street. The room as very clean and had all the comforts of home and more. It had hardwood floor throughout, a king size bed which was very comfortable, very nice white bedding, a 27 inch TV with a DVD player, nice size bar fridge, micowave, small dishwasher, sink, dishes, etc. to go with it all, a small washer and dryer, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, good sized safe that held a laptop computer and much more, good size desk and two very comfortable chairs - one leather office chair and one easychair with ottoman. It was very quiet, no noise from next door, above or below what so ever. The temperature control seemed to work well. Calls to guest services were dealt with promptly and politely. The conciere desk staff were very helpful on giving directions, restuarant recommendations, etc. Checkout was smooth, bell services kept my luggage from 8 AM - 2:30 PM for no charge. The VERY BEST THING about this hotel is it's LOCATION. You can exit directly from the hotel into the underground PATH system. You can go out the door, into the PATH system, turn left, go down a short flight of stairs and get on the subway. I walked to and from my course (about two blocks away) without stepping outside, no jacket or umbrella's required. The entertainment district is within walking distance as is the Eaton Centre mall. And when you have a bunch of bags to carry back after shopping all evening at the mall, you can just hop on the subway for $2.75 and get a ride straight from the mall to the hotel in a matter of minutes - again all without stepping outside. The hotel lobby is grand and beautiful. Had room service once - it was a little pricey but the food and service were excellent. They offer a long distance/internet package for $4.99/night. Gives you high speed internet and unlimited long distance which I used extensively. Worth every penny. Had no problems connecting to the internet. High speed - although not wireless worked very well. Paid $209/night which is a steal for a hotel of this quality in this location. Would gladly stay there again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, location can't be beat

reviews.text: I did a lot of research when booking my Toronto accommodation as I wanted to be central in location, and in a nice place that didn't cost the world. Reading other reviews narrowed things down a lot and when I found a good price advertised for 1 King West, I decided to take it.
reviews.title: Surprisingly great!

likes.liked: — Room service food, friendly bar atmosphere, complimentary car service

reviews.text: I loved this hotel from the moment I arrived. The lobby is gorgeous, and as someone else previously reviewed, it reminded me of a private club setting - dim lighting (not too dim, just right!), a huge bar area, big lounges overlooking the lobby...
reviews.title: What a bargain!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was simple and fast and the lady was extremely pleasant. I was on floor 36 and had no issues with my room at all! My desk overlooked Yonge St, and the rest of the suite had city/water views which were beautiful. I was able to wash my clothes in the in-room washing machine which was handy since I was on a 3 week trip, and I also loved the fact that I would be able to cook myself if I wanted to. Everything you needed was there! It really was like a mini apartment that you could live in permanently.
reviews.title: There are better hotels in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ordered room-service dinner one night and it was the tastiest pasta dish I have EVER had from a hotel before - AND it was a big serving! Need I say more on how good the food was! Breakfast was also very tasty and in good portions!
reviews.title: It's definitely downtown!

reviews.text: A fantastic hotel - especially if your company's paying. Terrific location - links directly to the subway so there's no need to step outside as well as to the underground shopping concourse. It's more like an apartment hotel - with microwave, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, stove, kettle all included in the room.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Did not enjoy the Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room in The Suites At 1 King West for a night (May, 3 2008) so that I could fly into Toronto and not have to drive a great distance to get to my final destination.
reviews.title: What a great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The person at the front desk was very pleasant as she denied my request to be in the new tower on a floor that would give me a nice view of the city. I didn’t think that would be an issue given what appeared to be a great number of vacant rooms available judging by the lack of people in the lobby and bar area.
reviews.title: King of hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Instead, after she verified that I had booked my reservation through Travelocity, I was given a room in the "Historic Section" of the building on the tenth floor. The "Historic" part of the building was originally a bank that was built around 1906 and at some point in time converted to a hotel. Unfortunately, even after several upgrades, it still isn't desirable by today’s standards, even at one quarter of the cost at $212USD a night including taxes. And buy the way, the valet parking was an additional $40.
reviews.title: All style and no substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wecoming staff and helpful concierge. Clean good sized room (not really a suite). Given a room on 32nd floor with side lake view without asking. Only problem the sliding bathroom door which was difficult to keep shut, so not good if two sharing. Good location.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.text: While the front desk staff were able to accomodate my request for an early check-in upon arrival in the monring, I was quite dissapointed with most other aspects of my stay.
reviews.title: Poor Quality Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself had ample room, everything just felt as though corners were cut. The room itself needed some TLC, and felt a bit tired for a relatively new hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Staff was only average, room service was poor, and overall, hotel feels like it needs a power-washing on the outside, and a staff facelift/morale boost on the inside.
reviews.title: Sweet Suites

likes.liked: — The location, the suite, and the quality of the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location! My husband and I stayed for three nights at this property and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The best part of this hotel is the proximity to transportation, theatre and restaurants. Staff was very helpful; room was clean with a great view of the city and Toronto Islands from our 39th Floor room. Would recommend for anyone coming to Toronto for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Walked many a mile

likes.liked: — Decor and quality of the room and stylish lobby

reviews.text: Bit of a late review since stayed there a year ago but had to put one one.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.text: Simply fantastic hotel, I had been to Toronto previously and stayed at the Holiday Inn on King and had a good experience there, but this place was exceptional.
reviews.title: Loved the decor & location.

reviews.text: The staff were superb, attentive and knowledgable and the concierge desk and had no hesitation in helping us arrange our trips and evenings out ensuring we maximised out time there.
reviews.title: Extremely Nice - Very good service
Take it from me....worth the money..
reviews.text: The room was good, although an odd shape, and had good amenties and was very clean and tidy. This was a bonus as we were not planning on spending much time in our room at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was also pleasant and we spent many an evening taking a nightcap after an evening out.
reviews.title: Great place. Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bit of a mixed bag here but generally positive. The hotel is in a perfect location. You step off a subway train and its there if front of you. Nearby there are tons off shops, cafes and restaurants. The main sites are within walking distance too. Even though the hotel is located in the financial area amongst the skyscrapers of Toronto, it is better located than some of the the hotels near Bloor/Yonge which I thought was a bit out of the way.
reviews.title: Pretty good everything but not outstanding.

reviews.text: Rooms are nice and have great views. All include a CD player. DVD player, microwave, washer, dryer etc.
reviews.title: Not Toronto's best hotel

reviews.text: Service is good although one day out room wasnt cleaned very well and they lost the TV remote, other days were fine. One of the days we had a balcony room (1506, I think). Avoid these rooms as they have slanted windows without curtains. As a result, the light comes pouring in early in the morning and the heat can be unbearable.
reviews.title: Comedy of Errors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no pool in the fitness centre ... for some reaosn, I thought there was so I wasnt too happy when I only found a hot tub & sauna (but thats my mistake).
reviews.title: Very Good Value
Nice hotel in a great location!
reviews.text: Generally, a nice stay if it werent for the odd few niggles.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April and could not fault it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 23rd floor which was clean and large. The location ws excellent for exploring the city and we walked to all the points of interest and shopping areas.
reviews.title: WARNING - Stay elsewhere for special occasions!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were very helpful and pointed us in the direction of using the old limos for local journeys instead of taxis - need to book but its fun and free!
reviews.title: Can't believe last few posts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being in the city centre the hotel is busy with lots of tourists and business people alike but we liked the atmosphere it created and would recommend it as a place to stay,
reviews.title: What a place, what a room...but not perfect

likes.liked: — The lovely suite and fantastic views of Toronto
likes.disliked: — The check-in staff and wait but I guess no-ones perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at several downtown Toronto hotels, although this was the first time here at 1 King West. I booked the room over a month ahead of time by phoning the hotel for a one night stay. We were headed into Toronto for a concert at the Air Canada Centre. At the time of booking the hotel (1 month ahead), I made 2 simple requests - a King Size bed and a car ride through their complementary car service. I was told that most beds were Kings in the hotel and they would put a note on my reservation requesting such a bed. I was offered a Tower Superior Room for $239, which was supposed to be one of the better rooms according to the hotel. I booked the car service with the valet, who told me the date and time was open and inked me in.
reviews.title: black hole

reviews.text: I'm visiting Toronto from the states for a conference, and this was the conference hotel. So I can't say that I have shopped around for comparable rooms in the downtown Toronto area. To me, the room rate seems reasonable. BUT, there are so many inconveniences or oddities that make me think that staying somewhere else would have been a good choice.
reviews.title: The quirks outnumber the perks

reviews.text: THE ROOM - the room is very oddly shaped -- extremely long, and very narrow. I actually ran laps in it my first night, since I couldn't go walking outside due to the rain. OK - not a big deal.
reviews.title: Dirty - stay away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE INTERNET, part one - Like others had commented, only the lobby area is wi-fi; the rooms are hard wired. There is a small desk in the room where the ethernet cable clearly should be, since there is a port for it in the lamp. I look all over the desk area (which takes 2 seconds, because it's quite small) and then call down to the front desk. They then treated me like an idiot, as if I didn't know what an ethernet cable was. They sent their "Tech Support" up -- dude, I don't need tech support to find an ethernet cable. Anyway, it's the hotel maintenance guy who shows up. He doesn't see the cable, and then remembers that it's tucked away....behind the bed. He has to pull the bed out from the wall (crawling all over my sheets to do so) and he says I can use the internet from in bed. I ask for a longer cable, so he proceeds to crawl all over my sheets again in order to wind the cable across the room. I spend all of my trip with an ethernet cable draped across the room, as I sit in one of their uncomfortable chairs, with the laptop on my lap. Stupid.
reviews.title: Worst experience ever

reviews.text: THE INTERNET, part two: connection speed - Terrible. TERRIBLE! And spotty. I don't know if this is an issue of #FirstWorldProblems or what, but it's not like I'm visiting a developing nation. C'mon, Canada!
reviews.title: Visited 4 Rooms, ALL BAD

reviews.text: IN-ROOM AMENITIES - very plain. It was a pleasant surprise to find a washer / dryer in the room, not that I was staying long enough to use that. But were I staying longer, that could have been a great asset in terms of reducing the number of clothes I brought. The in-room coffee / tea service is cheap, cheap, cheap. I drank one of my bags of tea one morning (the caffeinated one, and opened the fixers packet to access the tea. I noticed that room service had set an extra bag of tea down for me, and I thought that was sweet of them -- giving me an extra bag of tea for the morning. In the morning, I then realized that the extra bag was the one tea I HADN'T had. And, the fixings bag was simply replaced as is -- torn open, and with the sugar missing. RIDICULOUS.
reviews.title: Basic Reasonable Price Down Town Toronto Hotel

reviews.text: I went for a convention in Toronto and stayed nearly a week at One King West. The hotel has a good location in the centre. Got a room at the 13th floor (a bit unusual to find floor no 13:-)). I´m sure the room was really nice 10 years ago but today it came across at slightly old and oldfashioned. The breakfast was nice but for the price (over 30 dollar) I expect more. A very average hotel thats a little bit boring. The aircondition in the room started every hour and sounded like a truck next to the bed.
reviews.title: seen its best days

reviews.text: Stayed 7 nights at the One King West. Great rooms with complete kitchenettes, washing machine, etc. Wonderful shower. No free wifi... Kinda lame for a business hotel. Check in / check out very smooth. Hotel had a power failure for more than half a day and the better part of an evening but only provided free lemonade to guests as a compensation... No comments. This is a conveniently located business hotel but nothing special.
reviews.title: Classic business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. We made the booking by phone after we found it on the internet. The room was in the old part of the building, spacious with a kitchen area. We were happy with the room. If we gave the room a 10, we would give 0 to the people service.
reviews.title: Good Room but Disappointing People Service

reviews.text: We stayed at Le Meridien the night before because One King West was full. We walked with 2 heavy luggages on foot to the hotel the next day. When we arrived, 2 bell service staff were outside, none of them came to help. They just waved their arms saying " in there"...pointing us the direction of the check in counter. When I was waiting for my husband during the check-in, none of the bell service staff inside the hotel looked my way. I was soaking wet (due to the rain) and had 2 luggages...standing beside the main entrance. They seemed to be so busy with whatever they were doing that they totally ignored me. It's a very small area...I don't think they didn't see me. We got the luggage up to the room ourselves.
reviews.title: My official go-to in T.O.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Day 2, I asked the bell service to book a taxi to take us to a far away area that evening...the young man said it's taken care of...and I assumed it was. When we went to the bell service, they said there's no record showing that we had asked for a taxi. The young man we talked to simply said "I was not here when you called, it was somebody else." What kind of attitude is this? No apology and apparently no training at all. When we came back later that evening, we got off the taxi and walked on the entry carpet that led to the front entrance...2 bell service staff were standing right in the middle of the carpet, facing our side, chatting to each other. None of them gave us a look. None of them had the courtesy of moving aside to let us pass. We had to "detour" to avoid walking into them.
reviews.title: Great downtown hotel
Good location but so-so place
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nites in June 2006. This hotel advertises itself as "SUITES" at 1 King West. I think this is false advertising. My husband & I had a very nice ROOM at a reasonable rate for downtown Toronto, but it was by no means a "suite". It was actually one room with a very small bathroom plus a counter with a sink , a microwave & small frig on the counter and a small dishwasher & small washer & dryer under the counter. It was nice . . . but I guess when I hear the word "suite" I think of more than one room - - - usually a bedroom separate from the living area . . . something like Embassy Suites offers.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel in the Heart of Toronto
reviews.text: This was a strange place. We had a terrible time just finding it!! There is no name or address on the front of the building! You have to drive around on a side street to the back of the hotel.

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
reviews.text: When we arrived in our room it was very warm. After looking all around for the thermostat we found that is was BEHIND a very large combination closet/TV armoire. We could not see it to adjust the temperature! We called the desk to see if maybe they had an answer or another room for us. After only 15 minutes the Gen. Manager & a big security guy appeared at our door and moved this huge armoire over about 12 inches so we could get at the thermometer. I have to give the manager a plus for that.

reviews.title: Great value!
reviews.text: This was a nice place but I do resent the fact that its rooms are billed as "suites".

reviews.title: Excellent choice!
reviews.text: I recently spent two nights at The Suites on King in Toronto. The hotel is very affordable, clean and comfortable. It is also within walking distacne of many Toronto attractions including the Skydome, CN Tower, Air canada Centre and shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here at the end of our holiday and were absolutely thrilled with our room. It was clean, tastefully furnished and the bed was really comfortable. We were on the 29th floor and we had a superb view of Lake Ontario, Toronto Downtown and a glimpse of the Tower. Everyone at this hotel was extremely hospitable and respectful towards us from the moment we arrived until we left. Being able to enter our hotel downstairs directly from the subway was a bonus after a lot of shopping at Eaton Centre which is close by. We hired a car from the concierge desk to visit Niagara Falls for the day and they arranged everything for us perfectly. I would highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: I'm starwood platinum, but having fulfilled my minimum quota to renew my status for this year, I decided to give this hotel a try since I was heading to an early morning meeting across the street. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful, if not a little hodge podge. They're constrained by a very narrow plot of land on which the hotel sits, and so it seems the lobby bar is sort of in the way, and everything seems like it's just jammed in there.
reviews.title: Solid hotel with some issues

reviews.text: I received a premium view room with a nice view south and east. It was a spectacular view. However, while the front desk clerk said I would like the room more than my standard fare in Toronto, I think I'd disagree. It was probably modern in its day, but looking a little worn. Also, housekeeping wasn't as good as one would hope -- the glasses in the room had some crusty bits, hairs from previous guests on the bathroom toilet and in the sink, a bed that was made but not very carefully. Things you generally don't like to see in this kind of hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent for Business Travel

reviews.text: I think one of my biggest complaints would be that the air vent system, which seemed to be funnelled through one of the cupboards above the microwave, was very noisy. And it would run (perhaps for the hallway or other rooms?) even when my individual heating and cooling unit in the room was turned off. So it wasn't a very quiet room -- coupled with some car, street, and siren noise coming from 29 floors down on Yonge Street.
reviews.title: Bachelorette Party...fun, fun, fun!

reviews.text: Also, only wired internet in the room. And the desk is nowhere near the (tube) TV, so good luck working and having the TV on at the same time. It was a large room, but somewhat awkwardly laid out.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay in Toronto for 3 nights at the King West Hotel. The hotel was located on the main shopping street in downtown and not to far from the Eaton centre.... you may of guessed i did loads of shopping! From this hotel everything is in walking distance - habour/CN tower/nightlife etc. This is a great hotel for a tourist who can walk everywhere if the weather is good. The rooms were very big, with a washing and a dryer/cooking hob/ fridge/ mircrowave. as we were travelling alot we washed a few clothes very easy to use just need to buy some powder to put in tho. bathroom a good size... only annoying thing was that when other people closed there doors our door would shake as if someone was trying to enter into our room which woke me up a few times in the night as i thought someone was trying to get in!!! otherwise great hotel for tourists with a great locations to all the tourist attractions!!
reviews.title: Great Location Fab rooms

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at 1King West during a recent business conference. As stated in other reviews, verything you need is in the room (frige, washer, dryer, ironing board with a decent iron, two flat screen tv's, dvd player), along with some cute extras. For the coffee machine, instead of the cheap powdered creamer, there were the miniature tubs of creamer and Equal instead of the off brand pink stuff. We have found that quite a few hotels restrict use of the input jacks in the tvs so they can sell you movies and viceo games, but we were able to hook up our own equipment to the tvs.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with PRICEY Valet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice one bedroom suite room (can't remember the number) on the 14th floor with a balcony. The balcony had no chairs, so we just opened the doors and enjoyed the breeze. The windows in the bedroom were functional and we enjoyed the fresh air.
reviews.title: Poor hotel in a good location

likes.disliked: — The dirty room that was never properly cleaned in 6 days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar downstairs is nice during the evening. Great atmosphere and people-watching. Room service ended early. We bought some nasty frozen food to cook in the microwave...not recommended
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is close to a lot of very good shopping. Convneient to a drug store and Over Easy (great breakfast place).
reviews.title: Never ever again
Greatest Hotel Ever!!!
reviews.text: After reading the great reviews of The Suites at One Key West in Toronto on your website, we decided to make a reservation. The rates were so incredibly inexpensive that we were a little apprehensive, but, decided to take a chance. The hotel exceeded our expectations! The rooms were brand new. They were extremely clean, the beds were unbelievably comfortable and we had a refrigerator, washer & dryer, and microwave. The service was superb. We were treated like we were VIP's at a 5-star hotel. The valets and concierge were extremely helpful, as were the desk staff. We parked our car with the valet and didn't need it again for the entire stay. We were chauffered around in either a vintage Rolls Royce or Bentley by the professional staff for no charge (we did tip them though). It was such a nice touch to a wonderful vacation. We highly recommend this hotel!!

reviews.title: Perfect stay!
reviews.text: We stayed here on two different occations in August for 5 nights and we were really satisfied. Very nice suites , fully equipped and modern. Staff was great ( taking out a Bently when taxi drivers refused the short trip to The Fairmont Royal York with heavy bags) and location perfect. I later checked in at the Fairmont Royal York for the AIDS conference , but it was not nearly as good as the suites, which suprised me a lot. I would highly recommend this hotel. Also very good price when booking ahead on the internet.
Åsa Mellgren , Sweden
reviews.title: Credit Card overcharged - don't get the business package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in August 2006. The room was clean and the hotel was well-located. Upon check-in,
reviews.title: Clean and central

reviews.text: I was offered their "business package" (or something like that)
reviews.title: great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was spacious, quiet and very clean. I would sum up the negative points of some other reviews by saying that this property is new and they are clearly still working on "opening" and getting their procedures in place. We had a glitch with our cards upon check-in and the staff upgraded us to a deluxe 2-room suite on the 44th floor with views on 3 sides. We moved to this hotel after having a bad experience at the Cosmpolitan, which is right across the street. We did not have any problems or costs involved with getting our car in and out, and another cool benefit is that the concierge staff has a fleet of vintage cars (Bentley, '60 Cadillac, Rolls) with drivers who will take you to various downtown sites for free (with an advance reservation).
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An awesome ending to a great vacation..... We always enjoy spending a couple days in Toronto after Induction Weekend at Baseball Hall of Fame. First time at Suites at King West and will definitely be back again. Upper level accomodations with great view of skyline including CN Tower. Took advantage of Lord of the Rings theatre package which was second to none. Only negative was that some things were still "under construction."
reviews.title: NoKaOi......Second to None!!!!

reviews.text: Highly reccomended!!!!!
reviews.title: One King West is a City Centre Gem

likes.liked: — Standard of room and location in the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked late but got an excellent rate online for a stay in July 2006. I am a woman travelling alone from the UK, and had not been to Toronto before so was keen to stay somewhere safe and comfortable in the city centre. This hotel was such a great find and if I go back to Toronto I would not consider staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Wow what a view!!
Enjoyed our stay there
reviews.text: I am well travelled and expect high standards and this hotel did not disappoint. The suite had amazing views of the city. The room was excellent with every amenity you could need and was spotlessly clean. Other reviews have complained about the time you have to wait for the lifts but I was on the 46th floor and every single time I used the lift it was there almost instantly so I definitely disagree with those comments.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here at the end of September beginning of October. We payed around £69 per room per night for this hotel and expected to get the basic studio room, which we did (7th floor), but it was absolutely fine for our needs. Lovely king size comfortable bed, kitchenette with 2 rings for cooking (no cookware apart from kettle though there was microwave cookware and some utensils, plates, cups etc), coffee machine, microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, safe and t.v., the air conditioning was good. Our view only overlooked the internal atrium but we didn't expect more for this price. As mentioned on previous reviews, there is not much natural light in these rooms, but we found the bathroom light adequate. We could read fine with the room lights on. Housekeeping called daily and the room was very clean. The location is brilliant and in the evening if you just go east along Wellington or Colborne and walk down Church, the area where Wellington meets Front Street is really good for bars and restaurants, if you then walk down Church onto the Esplanade, there are lots of places where you can sit out in the evening when the weather is good (as it was when we we there) literally minutes away from the hotel. We would stay again and definitely recommend it. I would post photos but they are identical to the ones already posted! Seeing the lights of the financial district buildings lit up (although I know it is a terrible waste of electricity) was a favourite view of mine when walking back to the hotel at night.
reviews.title: We loved it

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed and size of room
likes.disliked: — No view and not much natural light

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 6 nights and requested a low floor studio apartment. Although the studio was quite dark as it receives limited natural light, initially it was ideal whilst we were jet lagged, however, by day 3 the poor lighting made reading difficult. On the plus side the studio was equipped extremely well and we heard minimal noise from other apartments. The large bed was comfortable and everything spotlessly clean. The staff we dealed with were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Seeing the old bank vault in the basement was amazing. The orginal part of this building has lots of banking history and there is a free guided tour plus information boards. Whilst we were there only one of the whirl pools was working, but as we were on our own it was not a problem.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent for trains, shops, eateries, cinema etc. From the basement there is a direct walkway to the sub life of eateries etc and an easy walk to the CN Tower, Union Station etc. We never required a taxi. A good supermarket is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return but request a room with more natural light.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in a downtown location

reviews.text: I stayed there for 2 nights for business in April.
reviews.title: Great location but disappointing service...not good value for your money...

reviews.text: Thums Up:
reviews.title: Uncomfortable Beds, Old TV's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Great location: close to the heart of downtown Toronto and the subway station
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: -Was given vouchers for free breakfast
reviews.title: No running water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The room is clean
reviews.title: Awesome place to stay downtown Toronto
Best value in Toronto
reviews.text: Just got back from a 3 night stay at The Suites and I was very happy with everything. For the price of the room ($180US per night) it almost certainly can't be beaten in downtown Toronto. We were up on the 32nd floor with a great view, the room was spacious & clean, comfortable bed, washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, desk, etc. You can walk to almost any attraction, but if you want to ride they have a complimentary car service. I have stayed on Queen Street in the hip area, but why pay 2 or 3 times the price when it's just down the road?
I have really mixed feelings about this hotel.
reviews.title: Not Good. Not Bad. Ok.

reviews.text: I had a really great room on the 29th floor (2910) which seems to be larger than many of the other rooms and had a very comfortable large bed, sofa and the desk area and a small kitchen area. In the kitchen area is a washing machine, tumble dryer, microwave and fridge. the decor was stylish, the pictures on the wall attractive photos and the
reviews.title: Definitely not for me...

likes.liked: — Big room, clean and in good condition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: view was really quite amazing. I had corner windows on 2 sides and then windows looking out over to the water where in the early evening
reviews.title: The best yet!!!

reviews.text: the water was full of small sailing ships. The bathroom was small with small bath that was more of a shower than a bath but you could have had a bath if you wanted one.
reviews.title: NIce stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights between arriving in Tornoto for the first time and boarding the VIA train for the Rockies, thus to walk out of the door into a subway station and PATH network of underground shops and routes was ideal. It is walking distance to the CN Tower, the ferry to Toronto Island, Central Station and numerous restaurants.
reviews.title: Ideal location
Pretty Good
reviews.text: Our studio room, though compact, was well equipped with free internet access, washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, cooking hob and microwave (and an electric kettle!). The room looked onto a brick wall on which was a mural painted and lit to look like sky thus negating any feeling of clostraphobia.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was friendly and efficient and we will certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice rooms, friendly staff - then everyone in Toronto seems to be friendly, I was there during the film festival - it's about a 20 minute walk to Bloor & Younge, which was a nice streach in the morning. I had grand hopes for the gym - it could probably do with more space/facilities. It has a 'pressure pool' - which is basically a tiny swimming pool with a strong current going one way, in which you exercise. Here in Ireland, we have full lenght swimming pools, which are much better. The views from the gym, it has to be said, are amazing.
reviews.title: Can't fault this

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Suites on the first leg of our honeymoon and it was a magnificent stay. The staff were always very helpful and the room was superb. The suite that we stayed in was a superior suite (upgraded because we were on honeymoon) and had the most amazing views over the city and the lake. It is very centrally located and is great value for money. We have recommended it to friends who have since stayed there and totally agree with us. It really was a special stay for us and we enjoyed every minute. We couldn't recommend this highly enough.
reviews.title: A winner

likes.liked: — Beautifully appointed, very tasteful. They will let you bring your dog too.
likes.disliked: — Dark rooms, but you can pay more to get a view and natural light.

reviews.text: This hotel was clean and very comfortable. Staff were very pleasant and acommodating throughout and I had no difficulties with odours or noise. I got my room for 135$ and for a room of this quality in downtown Toronto I would say I underpaid by at least $50.
reviews.title: Great hotel, well above average value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only complaints -- and they are very minor -- are that the room was advertised as including a DVD player and kettle. These were missing. In addition, the TV was a little long in the tooth (still a CRT rather than a flats screen). Service and comfort more than made up for these minor deficiencies.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Convenient Location

reviews.text: This hotel was the best I've stayed in yet. It's in a fantastic location, close to all major attractions/activites.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My colleague and I stayed at this hotel from March 21st to March 25th and we have nothing to rant about except for certain little things.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we've stayed in. Easy walking distance to hockey arena. Everything you could want in a hotel.

reviews.text: The pros :
reviews.title: Great Location but needs updating

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at this new hotel in the Financial District. Front desk staff were very nice and efficient. Although the rooms are labeled suites, ours was more like an fairly large hotel room with extra amenities (fridge, microwave, washer/dryer, etc.). Still, it was more than adequate, and quite comfy and clean. The views from the upper floors are fantastic. For convenience, it can't be beat. There is a subway stop at the hotel as well as an entrance to the PATH (underground shopping), but the best part is that antique cars are available to take you wherever you want for free (reserve in advance and tip the driver of course). The restaruant (Dominion Club) has an impressive atmoshpere and is very reasonably priced. However, while we found the breakfast to be good we were much less impressed with dinner there. Had it not been raining buckets we would have ventured out to one of Toronto's many fine restaurants. Nevertheless, it is a find and reasonably priced (at least for now) hotel. I would stay there again and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Experience at 1 King West

likes.liked: — Views, antique cars for transportation around town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I was trying to find a hotel in Toronto, I found that they were probably rather more expensive than I had expected. That said I did want a hotel in downtown.
reviews.title: One the best hotels I have stayed in

reviews.text: The room I booked at 1 King West was booked about 10 weeks before my visit at $159. When I checked in I was allocated a room on the 42nd floor!
reviews.title: Best Value in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was superb - clean/bright/good bed/ good facilities (coffee maker/washing machine/dishwasher/microwave/and lots of microwaveable dishes) and a fantastic view!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

likes.disliked: — Look for deals on travel websites

reviews.text: Lifts were good - so often in hotels you have to wait for ages for the lift to arrive, only to find it is full when it gets to you - not here - plenty of capacity.
reviews.title: An Excellent Value
Very classy
reviews.text: Upon arrival at the hotel we were initally impressed with the grandeur of the lobby area and the sense of class it seemed to exude. This nice early impression was soon quashed however by the cold and rather rude welcome given by the rather uppity guy on the front desk. Instead of advising of how much would be taken as pre authorisation he just took the card and swiped without asking our permission. When we queried the high amount taken as pre authorisation ($110 a day!) the guy kind of looked down his nose at us as if we were tourist peasants and said 'well its' gone through'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This kind of stuck up attitude kind of set the standard for the remainder of our stay. We encountered this kind of frosty service whenever we approached reception. It seems that because we did not appear to be high flying business types and instead came across as lowly tourists we were not worthy of their service.
reviews.title: Practically perfect!

likes.disliked: — The lobby area. Also, heavy blackout drapes hard to open and close (but got the job done once they were shut)

reviews.text: Come on guys has spending all that time in the company of snooty businessmen rubbed off on you? come on i mean you are only receptionists?! don't dismiss the tourist trade. If you dont want mere mortals like us at your hotel then don't advertise on tourist websties.
reviews.title: Large, well appointed rooms

reviews.text: The hotel room itself was aesthetically pleasing with modern minimalist stylings. The bathroom was fairly small but looked stylish. The addition of a washing machine and dryer was a nice touch as i managed to get all my clothes clean and dry before flying home.
reviews.title: Location, location

likes.liked: — Location and presentation of the room
likes.disliked: — Getting access to the air condition switch which was behind the big wardrobe

reviews.text: I had a great time at the hotel and the service was wonderful! Once I got back, I realized I had left a GPS watch at the hotel. I went onto to the website and clicked on "contact" and the only email address was to Steve, the GM of the hotel. I thought I would never get a response or see the watch. Within a few minutes, I got a reply and within the hour, the staff called to ask where they could ship the watch to! AMAZING service! I will never stay at another hotel in Toronto. This place is perfect for business or pleasire and the service is among the best!
reviews.title: Found my watched and sent it to me!

reviews.text: During a recent business trip to Toronto I had the pleasure of staying at One King West. Not only was the hotel ideally located for the centre of Toronto, the accommodation exceeded my expectations and the staff were hepful and friendly.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no hesitation in recommending One King West to others.
reviews.title: Luxury & Location

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Suites at One King West for a "night out on the town" on my 50th birthday. Friends joined us at the hotel. We had a relaxing drink & snacks in the hotel lobby bar and then walked down to one of Toronto's many restaurant areas to enjoy a great meal.
reviews.title: spectacular
The best deal in Toronto!
reviews.text: The room was superb! Spacious, clean and plenty of amenities. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

aka: One King West Hotel And Residence
description: Immersive and inspiring, One King West Hotel & Residence invites you to a uniquely vibrant place to stay. Enjoy the genuine warmth and gracious service at this unique oasis of hospitality. Indulge in architectural grandeur, sophisticated comfort and personalized service at One King West. Connect yourself to the city’s core business, entertainment and shopping districts from this premier address. Come and see why One King West is a hotel to call home.
